library(p8105.datasets)

# Problem 1

## First, letâ€™s take a few minutes to understand the dataset and the variables it contains.

```{r}
str(ny_noaa)
nrow(ny_noaa)
ncol(ny_noaa)

n_station = 
  ny_noaa |>
  pull(id) |>
  n_distinct()

date_range = ny_noaa |>
  pull(date) |>
  range(na.rm = TRUE)
```

## Next, check the range of key variables

### prcp

```{r}
max_prcp_info = ny_noaa |>
  filter(prcp == max(prcp, na.rm = TRUE)) |>
  select(id, date, prcp)

min_prcp_info = ny_noaa |>
  filter(prcp == min(prcp, na.rm = TRUE)) |>
  select(id, date, prcp)
```

### snow & snwd

```{r}
max_snow_info = ny_noaa |>
  filter(snow == max(snow, na.rm = TRUE)) |>
  select(id, date, snow)

min_snow_info = ny_noaa |>
  filter(snow == min(snow, na.rm = TRUE)) |>
  select(id, date, snow)

max_snwd_info = ny_noaa |>
  filter(snwd == max(snwd, na.rm = TRUE)) |>
  select(id, date, snwd)

min_snwd_info = ny_noaa |>
  filter(snwd == min(snwd, na.rm = TRUE)) |>
  select(id, date, snwd)
```

## Then, count missing info

```{r}
na_snow = ny_noaa |>
  filter(is.na(snow)) |>
  count() 

na_snwd = ny_noaa |>
  filter(is.na(snwd)) |>
  count()

na_tmax = ny_noaa |>
  filter(is.na(tmax)) |>
  count()

na_tmin = ny_noaa |>
  filter(is.na(tmin)) |>
  count()
```
